page.title: 18RUSKINGTON PAST AND PRESENT5
page.content:
The stone house which stands at the junction of Lincoln Road and Westcliffe Road was built by a Mr. Barrand, a builder from Bradford in Yorkshire. It is interesting to note that he had all the stone used in its construction brought from his home town, apparently by rail - it was all second hand material! A certain Mr Frederick Tong (great grandfather of this researcher) was responsible for laying the foundation stones on which the Red Lion public house stands. Finally, the Mill House on Lincoln Road is one of the few houses in Ruskington to possess a cellar - the rectory also has one.
By William Luke age 10
